metadata.title: CVE-2021-30506 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect security UI in Web App Installs in Google Chrome on Android priorto 90.0.4430.212 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a webapplication to inject scripts or HTML into a privileged page via a craftedHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30506` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.4472.77-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
